intro: Myrsine, commonly known as the "mambo" or "shoe flower," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It includes approximately 300 species, many of which are shrubs or small trees found primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plants typically have simple, opposite leaves and produce small, white or yellow flowers that are often clustered in umbels. The fruits are usually small berries that contain one or two seeds. Myrsine species are often used in traditional medicine and have various ecological roles in their native habitats.
